info.description: These public APIs are designed to open up foundational Time Tracking functionality in REST. Use this API to give employees the ability to check in and check out of work and to review and modify their recent check-ins and check-outs. You can also use this API to enable managers to check in and check out of work for a worker, to view workers who are currently checked in for work, and to review and modify a worker's check-ins and check-outs.
info.title: Time Tracking

tags.name: timeClockEvents
tags.description: Create and manage time clock events.

get.description: Security Domain: Process: Time Clock Event REST API's

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Start date of the time event.

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: End date of the time event.

parameters.name: worker
parameters.description: ~Worker~ for the Time Block or Clock Event.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of instances to retrieve

post.description:
1. Adds a time clock event for the specified worker.
2. The data for the time clock event. These fields are required:  
    - worker
    - eventType
    - dateTime
    - timeZone
    - timeEntryCode (only for check-in events)
3. Position can be required if worker has multiple positions.
4. Not only is time entry code required, but project or Project Plan Task (PPT) can also be required for a given worker.

delete.summary: Delete a pass-in time clock event
delete.description: Delete a pass-in time clock event

dateTime.description: Returns the Date Time for a Time Clock Event.

reference_ID.description: The Reference ID to use for lookups within our Workday Web Services. For supervisory organizations, this is also the 'Organization ID' (Internal API Use Only)

comment.description: Comment associated with the Time Clock Event. (Internal API Use Only)

items.description: This object represents the possible facets for this resource

facetParameter.description: The alias used to select the facet

count.description: The number of instances returned by this facet
